decks.notes: This deck combines creature toolbox cards with combo pieces to create a synergistic strategy. It utilizes cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling to tutor creatures like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician. Blood Artist and Malevolent Rumble provide additional combo potential, while cards like Endurance and Young Wolf offer protection for key pieces. The deck aims to control the board with its versatile creatures and disrupt opponent's strategies while building towards a game-winning combo finish. Boseiju, Who Endures and Agatha's Soul Cauldron provide additional utility and resilience to the deck's overall strategy.

The main strategy of this Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's plans with a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. It also aims to control the board and gain card advantage through efficient removal and card draw effects. The deck utilizes cards like Psychic Frog and Murktide Regent to pressure the opponent while disrupting their strategy. By using a combination of removal, counterspells, and card advantage, this deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and ultimately outvalue them in the late game.

The deck focuses on utilizing Tameshi, Reality Architect to assemble a powerful combo and control the game through disruptive spells like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. It also includes ramp cards like Lotus Bloom and Wargate to accelerate its game plan. The main win condition is to search for key pieces with Green Sun's Zenith or Wargate and eventually overwhelm the opponent with a big creature like Cultivator Colossus or Omnath, Locus of Creation. The deck also has a toolbox approach with versatile cards like Endurance and Finale of Devastation to adapt to different situations.

The deck focuses on aggressive Boros creatures and burn spells to quickly overpower opponents. By combining efficient creatures like Ragavan and Phelia with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and relentlessly. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional support and card advantage, while Static Prison and Arena of Glory help control the board and protect your creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents early in the game and maintain pressure throughout to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on deploying low-cost creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive spells and creatures. It aims to put pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with cards like Ephemerate and Aether Vial. The deck also has a strong creature recursion and card advantage engine with cards like Flickerwisp and Recruiter of the Guard. By efficiently using removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude, it can clear the way for its creatures to attack and secure the win.

This aggro deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Burning Inquiry to power out powerful creatures like Hollow One and Detective's Phoenix. Dragon's Rage Channeler helps to filter draws and enable additional threats while also adding pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble and Tarfire helps to enable additional synergies and provide extra value. The key goal is to maintain a fast-paced and relentless assault on the opponent.
